refresher.title: üö¶ Real-Life Story: Traffic Signal
refresher.content:
# Traffic Signal Logic

- Red ‚Üí Stop
- Yellow ‚Üí Ready
- Green ‚Üí Go

Only **one signal shows at a time**.

---

## Same in React

React shows UI **based on conditions**.

If condition is true ‚Üí show something
If condition is false ‚Üí hide it

This is called **Conditional Rendering**.

concept.title: üß† Basic Condition
concept.content:
## Example

```
{isLoggedIn && <Dashboard />}
```

- If `isLoggedIn` is true ‚Üí Dashboard shows
- If false ‚Üí Nothing shows

React simply **follows the condition**.

positive.title: ‚úÖ Login Example
positive.description: Show welcome message only if user is logged in.
positive.explanation: The message appears only when `isLoggedIn` is true.

concept2.title: üîÄ if‚Äìelse using Ternary
concept2.content:
## Ternary Operator

```
{isLoggedIn ? <Dashboard /> : <Login />}
```

- True ‚Üí Dashboard
- False ‚Üí Login screen

Used when you must choose **one of two UIs**.

negative.question: What is wrong?

options.text: if statements cannot be used directly in JSX
options.explanation: Correct. JSX only allows expressions, not statements.

negative.lesson: JSX allows expressions like ternary and &&, not raw if blocks.
